values:
I'm not fucking perfect.  The subtitle of this journal states that I am self-absorbed.

I was hoping for an END to the drama after the week I had. 

You seem really irrational and full of defense mechanisms.  Feel free to contact me once you've calmed down and can form some semblance of compassion but I can not deal with you right now.  It hurt to completely remove you but I had to.  I love you but for the life of me I CANNOT UNDERSTAND YOU right now.
Copy this sentence into your livejournal if you're in a heterosexual marriage, and you don't want it "protected" by the bigots who think that gay marriage hurts it somehow.

Kurious Oranj reeked of dog.

Ah well.

There'll be another Element at this dealer for under $13K at some point.
Today is the 20th anniversary of my dad's death which is subsequently the 20th anniversary of when the fear stopped and thus I was able to begin living.

<lj-embed id="6" />


had to post this so I can finally return the DVD to Netflix ;)
And it is written that Kyle will take 99. And, yea, although Robbie will say "Goddammit" it will still be good.

Psoriasis strikes agayne.  I never identified the skin condition I have on my hands and feet that my dad so lovingly passed doen to me but the last masseuse did.  I just know it's a fucking pain.  So I've got sores on mah left foot (is so much stronger than my right foot, right, Stewie?) right at the arch.  Joy.  LUSH's Ultra Bland is the only thing helping.  I wish I knew where my ace bandage was.  Argh.

IHR almost got cancelled.  The Croc is under new management and is going to charge IHR aka Cassandra for usage of the place on the one Sunday a month.  Like I may have previously said I was surprised that she/we weren't charged before but whatever.  Prolly brings a lot of business to the cafe.  I know I get breakfast there when I am setting up and other vendors do too.  They are busy when we're there.  ANYHOO, so the new mgmt told Cassandra I guess on Friday that they didn't have enough staff to do it on Sunday and even tho she paid a big deposit they had to cancel.  Argh.  So she looked around I guess and now it is at BLVD Galery like a block away.  Next to Roq La Rue, Moira ;)

So that's good that the shoe is actually happening because I have like 5 people coming to get stuff or checking it out blah blah blah.  What I am not happy about, yeah, selfishly, is that there are no space assignments and so it's first come, first served?!?!  Oh yeah, waiting in line on 2nd Avenue, getting smelly and people no doubt smoking in line and on my sore foot, yay, with all my stuff.  Just want I wanna do after a nice shower.  Suckage.  Not happy.  And then my lungs ans sinuses will be shit and I have to work tomorrow and the next day la de da prolly the day after that.  I ws told 4 -5 days and it's already been 2 but the VP almost gave the impression that they could use me longer (after stating how impressed she was with me).  Anyhoo...

Also not happy because, well, because there's no assignments the jewelry peeps won't necessarily be spaced out well.  I HATE TALKING TO/BEING AROUND OTHER JEWELRY PEOPLE AT CRAFT SHOWS.  I will probably end up near annoying Mary who sells ming dynasty vase pendants on cord, oh yeah, THAT'S handmade.  I told Cassandra but I don't think she said anything because she thinks Mary is annoying too.  Why does her name have to be Mary?  I should call her by her full name.  There is a vendor called Erika as well but she doesn't do jewelry and she is grand :)

ALSO I wanted to bring my new sunshine lamp for light but I duno how that will go.  Actually, if it's a gallery I may not have to worry about lighting for once.  Ugh.

Thank fuck Jack In The Box serves burgers 24/7 because I want one and some seasoned curly fries.  Yay, go fat girl!

I guess I don't care about the things I have bitched about so much if I make some money.  

Nuffa dat.  I gotta get up and take a shower.  Argh.

Not safe for work but only because of LANGUAGE LANGUAGE AND MORE LANGUAGE.   But it's FUCKING HILARIOUS so watch it, pls.  Esp if you endured REM shoved down your throat in the 90s thanks to WHFS.

<lj-embed id="5" />

On the twelfth day of Christmas, mileshedgehog sent to me...
Twelve gus gus drumming
Eleven moody blues piping
Ten tom jones a-leaping
Nine sigur ros dancing
Eight black books a-milking
Seven magnetic fields a-swimming
Six cats a-laying
Five co-o-o-oen brothers
Four twin peaks
Three lush cosmetics
Two peter sellers
...and a bolshoi in a david bowie.
Get your own Twelve Days:

Some time ago <lj user=mynameismiles> echoed in his lj our massive dislike for Jose Feliciano (or probably anyone) singing "Feliz Navidad".

When I heard that bloody song for the second time today the words "My Least Favourite Song" came into my mind, sung to the tune of said song.

It made me smile.

Yay :)

Happy Birthday, <lj user=dessaudarling> and <lj user=tatooedlovegirl>!

And, as always, for one day and one day only, we are the same age ;)
Now go getcherself a free taco (between 2 and 5pm). (big love to for coming up with "Tacoby Bellsbury" in the first place!)

I had a dream on Saturday night that I was hanging with and she was showing me old school pics she took when she was younger and hung out with The Cure(???) and we were talking about roadies and the like and then all of a sudden I just burst into tears because I thought of . didn't know what to do because it was a very sudden action on my part. When I could gain enough composure I said "I'm sorry - it's just that 27 is way too young to die" Weird sentiment and not one I am focusing on IRL. Uh, happy belated birthday to . I actually had that dream on your birthday. A lot of other people are Oct 7 b'days and I hope you had happy b'days, too. *EDITED TO REMOVE THE STUPID iPOD BIT OUT BECAUSE IT HIT ME THAT IT WASN'T VERY FUNNY AT ALL BUT SAD BECAUSE I AM A DORK AND DIDN'T THINK ABOUT IT FIRST* I just had to type this out. I cannot stop thinking about her. I was going to send her care packages of jewelry supplies and basic jewelry books once her disability kicked in. I dunno if she sent anyone else extra stuff with their BUTTS bracelets but she sent me a bracelet and a necklace. Yeah, I posted about it and you guys probably read it. Anyhoo, I think she had potential and what better thing to do on disability than crafts? I am glad I got to tell her what she meant to me before she died. That was the best thing about her suicide attempt. I wonder if other people she knew feel the same. I need to get back to work.

RIP <lj user=danigolden>

This is like the worst thing ever.

I already rambled TWICE in her last LJ entry.

I wish you would have been wearing a seat belt and had some caffeine or something.

I love you.

I love <lj user=danigolden>.  She made me an extra special BUTTS bracelet only really long with heart beads and dice beads so I could hang it around my rearview mirror.  Oh the commute to and from Issaquah is going to rock now :)

She also made me a pretty necklace (I was thinking this past week that I need to make myself longer necklaces to wear to work but DUH PADDY PACKED MY TOOLS AND WIRE AND ETC SOMEWHERE) and a pretty memory wire bracelet that unfortunately does not fit my fat wrist.  OMFG WE ARE FAT WRIST TWINS!!!!!!!!!  One of the hedgehogs will wear it or maybe big Snoopy or Big Hello Kitty.  It's going in the apothecary drawers so I don't lose it.

NUBS!
Chris Benoit was suffering from dementia, not roid rage. Now all of the stone throwers out there can bite my ass.

There's no one in this world for me There's never gonna be There's no one in this world needs me There's never gonna be Yet sometimes in my dreams I hear... Sundown I miss you, sundown I need you, sundown Come on, come on, come on, come on, back to me Come on, come on, come on, come on, back to me I need you, sundown I need you, sundown There's no hands ever reached for me There's never gonna be There's no one meant for lonely me There's never gonna be Yet sometimes in my dreams I hear... Sundown I miss you, sundown I want you, sundown Come on, come on, come on, come on, back to me Come on, come on, come on, come on, back to me I love you, sundown I love you, sundown Sometimes in my dreams... I love you, sundown I love you, sundown Sometimes in my dreams...

Barton and Koschka both suffered in pain
Their endured turmoil was not in vain
The two, unrelated, have now gone to heaven
They meet MooMoo and Roddy and the ones from 7/7
There's Lily and Sallee and folks from 9/11

<small>(That's all I've got...)</small>

I screamed at the television when I saw his picture with "1967 - 2007" at the bottom. It was like the most horrible joke. Then I just started crying and I haven't stopped. I did upload a video to YouTube of Chris Benoit doing his thing - I don't know what it's called. I don't like what I've read about it on wwe.com. I really hope they're speculating.

The reason why a lot of people did not like The Lady In The Water is that it was marketed as a horror movie and it is NOT A HORROR MOVIE.  It's more sci-fi or fantasy than anything.

(And next time <lj user=comraderadmila> comes to visit I will make sure to rent it because Bob Balaban's death scene is fucking hilarious.)

I dunno how I feel about M Night Shyamalan playing important roles in his own films.  I like the guy and I think he is a good actor and OF COURSE he is going to portray the characters in the way they're meant to be portrayed but...  it's just a little... I dunno.  Pre-fab?  I mean, you just see him and you know he's going to be an important man in the film.  His character in Signs was just... surreal.  I mea, when he's introduced in the film, "there he is", and Mel Gibson and Joaquin Phoenix and the kids all look at him and I was thinking "uh, yeah, he wrote, produced, and directed the movie, wtf?" but what it meant was that he killed Gibson's character's wife by accident.  Ummm, talk about yer run on sentences.

I do adore his mind, though. Maybe I am just not used to this kind of participation in a movie.  Stephen King's participations are funny and Alfred Hitchcock is like Waldo.

oh yeah, and the beginning of TLitW is hilarious.

During the movie I was reminded of the uber depressing ending to Broken Flowers.  Fuuuuuuuuuuuuuuck.

Ummmm also saw the end of Sexy Beast finally.  What a fucking great movie.  I want John to watch it with me but he won't because he doesn't like to watch British movies because he thinks I'll start talking cockney and talk about England and he's always sick of it.  Shame.  It's the same reason he hasn't watched the masterpiece that is Lock Stock...

Ging.  Paddy and I had a dumb arguement about Ken Griffey Jr.  The announcer on tv said Griffey hadn't been in Seattle for 9 years.  I said that wasn't right because I know I saw my First Mariners game here in 99 and Griffey was the only one that scored.  Unneccessary anger ensued and when I was looking it up to prove the announcer was wrong he got all nubby and knew he was going to be wrong and admitted he was an ass when I said "Mariners, 1989 - 1999.  Reds, 2000 - present.  That's NOT 9 years!"  Paddy said that he appreciates that not a lot of people would put up with his silliness.  Word that.

Hadassah likes socks.

Why, she's in Iceland, being 32, of course! (If she were here in Washington, she'd still be 31 - ahhhhh, sacrifices ;) )

HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO MY WUPA!!!!!

I HATE SMOKERS AND THEY ALL NEED TO DIE!!!

(well, the ones that live on this property, at least...)
we've spotted Michael Chiklis in the front row of tonight's show. I'm sure they'll show him close-up later. LOL. Nubs Chiklis!!!!!!!
Sir Stinksalot there in my icon would have been 27 today.  Who knows, maybe he's still alive.  I wouldn't put it past him.

Here's that picture of Nick Turturro taken last week at LAX: he looks tired. they had just stopped shooting and I bet it had been a long day. he was nice though :) Here's with a tie around his head: No, he wasn't going for that karate kid look of the 80s. We were both tired from lack of sleep and long days and grief and BEING IN THE FUCKING DESERT. That's my Uncle Jerry behind him aka the man who walked me down the aisle aka my dad's brother. One day perhaps I will bore you with the story of his name (it's not really Jerry) came from a Russian nickname and everyone in synagogues say it's a made up name. Weird, esp because he has a cousin (that goes by Larry) that has the exact same name. anyhoo... I started watching a horror movie on demand yesterday but I totally forgot what it was and what it was about. uhhhhh, wow, I am sick. I did see Broken Flowers and the ending made me sad :( Reminded me a little bit of About Schmidt because it's men on journeys but the end of About Schmidt made me cry but it was a GOOD ending. I also finally saw Shallow Grave which was fucked up. Haha funny thing while watching the Shield. Commercials for The Riches came on and John said that Eddie Izzard sounded like he was from New England. I laughed and said he was British, was a comedian, and liked to wear makeup and women's clothing. Anyhoo, it's the same accent Eddie used in Mystery Men like when he said "Baby Bowler". Hugh Laurie has the best American accent, IMHO. Actually, I'm surprised how good Minnie Driver's is. Anyhoo, ok, to bed with me.

I saw this yesterday and couldn't stop laughing so here it is. Zanna and Beth will especially like this. For those of you who don't know (like my foreign friendz) there has always been a big beef between the New York Yankees and the Boston Red Sox. Jorge "little Jewish boy" Posada of the Yankees to the left and table and David "Big Papi" Ortiz of the Red Sox (and also my icon) is the one in the middle, the guy that puts the hat on. (yes, I have a Wally Green Monster beanie - we got one in Boston.)

You scored higher than 0% on humour

You scored higher than 40% on hairiness
Link: The Father Ted Arsefeck Jumper Test written by Blamethedog on OkCupid Free Online Dating, home of the The Dating Persona Test

I was coming home from Nordstrom Rack this afternoon but couldn't turn into my condo complex. I had to go up Wolverine and turn around and then I noticed the left-turn lane was blocked off. The traffic light was blinking and there were cops all over and a news van across the street. The section that was taped off in front of my complex had a van in it but I couldn't tell what was going on. I got into the left-turn lane behind the cones, pointed to my complex and mouthed "I live there" to the cop and he stopped traffic to wave me through. It was weird. So now I know. Actually, John said he saw it on the news, our neighbour was a witness and was on TV and the anchorman was talking to the camera and you could see our building right behind him. I can't say I'm surprised - there have been a few times when the light turns green (when I'm leaving the complex - which is the ONLY time THAT light turns green) and I'm almost hit by someone going southbound, running a red light. Assmunch. I know it almost happens with people coming down off Wolverine as well. (they have a different light - hard to explain) Anyhoo, sheesh.
